titles.title: Authorizing the House Administration Committee to investigate, recount, and report on contested elections for the House of Representatives.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 1/5/1993--Introduced. Requires the Committee on House Administration to investigate contested election results if a candidate deposits $5,000 with the Clerk of the House of Representatives for expenses incurred in conducting a recount. Provides for a full refund of such amount if the committee determines that such recount alters the result of the election. Refunds any remaining amounts, after expenses, if a recount does not alter election results.
